content: The regular iPhone 14 barely feels like an upgrade, you should consider upgrading to the pro version. I would recommend you to Go Pro or Go Home.
If you're a normal user with the 13 or 14 Pro, there is not much difference. The phone is still the best video phone and doesn't have any heating issues.
I upgraded from a 14 pro that I got two years ago. I got the 16 pro white with 512g and I think it's a pretty good phone overall.
I bought an iPhone 14pro in May and I realized much later that my phone's camera quality and display doesn't match with other iPhone 14 pro.
Some prefer the iPhone 14 Pro for balance when looking at battery life and video features, I would highly recommend this phone.
After watching a few iPhone 15 reviews, I can tell that the camera on the iPhone 15 is generally better than the iPhone 14 Pro.
The experience is miles better on iOS, specifically the iPhone 14 Pro Max. I have played both these games for endless hours on both platforms.
The iPhone 14 Pro Max has great battery life and the battery can last all day. I ended the day with 37% battery remaining after 5 hours of use.
The iPhone 14 Pro Max is an excellent smartphone with cutting-edge features. I would recommend it if you're looking for a high-powered phone.
It's absolutely garbage for gaming. The phone is heavy, and when something is wrong with apps you downloaded from the Apple Store, you can't review it.
I am typing this with this garbage sorry for the harsh words.
I am typing this with this garbage sorry for the harsh words. The only pro is that you can show off.
It's absolutely garbage for gaming. The phone is heavy, and when something is wrong with apps you downloaded from the Apple Store, you can't review it.
The iPhone 14 Pro Max is an excellent smartphone with cutting-edge features. I would recommend it if you're looking for a high-powered phone.
There is NO DIFFERENCE between the iPhone 13 and iPhone 14. The display, camera, battery, CPU, charging, external design are all identical.
It's absolutely garbage for gaming. The phone is heavy, and when something is wrong with apps you downloaded from the Apple Store, you can't review it.
The iPhone 14 Pro Max is an excellent smartphone with cutting-edge features. I would recommend it if you're looking for a high-powered phone.
It's absolutely garbage for gaming. The phone is heavy, and when something is wrong with apps you downloaded from the Apple Store, you can't review it.
It's absolutely garbage for gaming. The phone is heavy, and when something is wrong with apps you downloaded from the Apple Store, you can't review it.
I use my iPhone 14+ for basic tasks. The calendar and contacts transfer was faulty from my Samsung. I'll use it until it dies.
Peter McKinnon's review of the iPhone 14 Pro was awful, lacking depth and detail about the lenses and technical aspects.
Apple's always-on display implementation is poor, showing too much. It should only show basic information like date and notifications.
The camera reviews are so different. People whose reviews I trust think the iPhone 14 Pro camera is great overall.
The always-on display is too bright. Android phones have had better customization for years. It's a waste of potential.
I absolutely love this phone. Upgrading from the 12 Pro, the battery life is amazing, and the 120 hertz screen is noticeable.
Dynamic Island forces interaction at the top of the screen. The 13 series has better bottom placement for screen interaction.
I'm going Pro Max after my mini ran out of battery on a mountain. Satellite connection is a game changer for emergencies.
I can't imagine spending 1k on a TV with dead pixels obstructing my view. Notch or pill, it will never feel normal to me.
The dynamic island is a cool idea, but too tall and high. It's more intrusive than my XS Max notch when viewing full screen videos.
The cosmic orange iPhone 17 Pro is amazing! The camera quality is noticeably sharper to my amateur photographer's eye.
The 14 Pro/Max camera is a significant upgrade. There's still a difference but it is far smaller than before.
The new iPhone 14 Pro camera is amazing. It seems to have a small problem figuring out which mode to use.
Took insane photos at night trick or treating. The photos and videos under low lighting are incredible on the iPhone 14.
I love the phone and the camera, but the huge camera bump is a downside. This is a phone that needs a sleeve for protection.
I purchased the 14 Pro but returned it as it wasn't enough of an upgrade over my 13 Pro. Now I have a Pixel 7.
Apple will simply work. It'll charge, connectivity will be consistent, monthly updates are unlikely to break anything.
I upgraded and I'm loving the vanilla Android experience. The phone is warm and has few bugs I hope they fix soon.
Video on iPhone is MUCH better than Pixel. Face unlock in low/poor lighting is TERRIBLE on the pixel.
I went from iPhone 13 Pro to Pixel 7 Pro and I miss my longer battery life. Rest all is good though.
Price to performance ratio the Pixel probably wins. If you can get along with iOS the iPhone 14 Pro is great.
Don’t buy the Pixel. The battery life isn’t good compared to the iPhone 14 pro. I just returned it.
The Pixel 7 pro is has better build quality, performance, battery life, and 3rd party apps than an iPhone 14 Pro.
I wouldn't want to ditch iOS because of the operating system. Also think about what products work best with iOS and Android.
I miss a lot about android. But if you’re an iMessage, Apple Watch, or AirPods user, the experience just cannot compare.
I've encountered a few annoyances and bugs. It comes with the territory every time I've switched from iOS to Android.
The key difference for me is the battery life between the 2 phones. 8hrs on iPhone 14 vs 4.5 on Pixel 7.
I prefer Android, and always have done. IOS is too restrictive, but it is a slick package, that just works.
Not worth switching to the Pixel. Switching cost is high and the experience is good but not good enough to make the swap.
I would like Apple if the ecosystem wasn't so suffocating. I love my P7P and I am very disappointed with OnePlus 9 Pro.
The new iPhone 14 Pro finally catches up to the Pixel 6 Pro camera. Pixel cameras will continue to be class leading.
Sometimes my camera is wow, beautiful. Other times my photo is oil painted and blurry when you zoom in the phone.
Apple silicon being iOS only is such a tragedy. I wish the processing power was used for android phones as well.
The Pixel just has to hold up against having a better fingerprint sensor, modem, battery, and video quality compared to iPhone.
Wonder if the pixel 6 pro camera updates have actually made a difference compared to the iPhone 13 pro when it launched.
Too bad video is still way behind and the Tensor processor doesn't compare to the A15/16 chips in the iPhone.
Pixel is great for photos, but video and apps are better on iPhone. It sucks to spend $1K on a phone with problems.
I stay with Pixel for its great shots. But I think their luck might run out if Apple goes for a periscope zoom.
Sure it takes great shots, but in well lit conditions so does cheaper Xiaomi. I’d rather have a phone that works well overall.
Pictures of people don't always come out great on the Pixel 6. Skin tones can look darker than they look in real life.
The pixel constantly dies. People are always coming up to me saying they've been trying to text me and I don't respond.
The 14 Pro has 2 hours less battery despite having a larger battery than the 13 Pro. While the Max has longer battery.
